image.altText: Two bystanders look on at helicopter crash scene.

props.synopsis: First responders have recounted the "absolute chaos" after two Sea World helicopters crashed in 2023, killing four people.

title.children: Inquest hears of 'absolute chaos' after deadly Sea World helicopter crash

image.altText: Donald Trump places a hand on his chest.

props.synopsis: Trump cares little for alliances. So his presidency could well offer a priceless gift to Australia: a rare moment when national self-interest can eclipse sentiment.

title.children: Trump putting America first could be a priceless gift to Australia

image.altText: EU Trade Commissioner Maroš Šefčovič seated for an interview.

props.synopsis: The European Union will ask the United States to establish a "steel union" of higher tariffs and tighter import restrictions — which could have knock-on effects in Australia's steel sector — at crucial talks in Brussels on Monday.

title.children: Why the EU moved to preference military hardware purchases from its members

image.altText: Pauline Hanson wears a burka in the Senate.

props.synopsis: The Australian Senate has resumed sitting after it was shutdown when One Nation leader Pauline Hanson wore a burka on the floor of the upper house. Follow live.

title.children: Senate resumes sitting after Hanson wears burka into the upper house

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What are the rules behind a Senate suspension?
Senate suspends after Hanson sanctioned, refuses to leave chamber
Pauline Hanson wears burqa in Senate

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling as she sits in front of a Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: The sister of the man accused of murdering Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley has told a court she has spoken to her brother "two or three times a week" since his extradition from India.

title.children: Family searched India for man accused of Toyah Cordingley murder, court hears

image.altText: Dark clouds over a pool and trees in background.

props.synopsis: Residents in far-north WA are being warned of expected damaging wind and heavy rain today as Cyclone Fina approaches the Kimberley region.

title.children: Far-north WA residents expecting damaging wind and rain as Cyclone Fina approaches

image.altText: A huge, threatening-looking storm system over a city.

props.synopsis: Lightning, destructive winds and hail have hit large parts of the state, with more than 100,000 homes losing power.

title.children: More than 120,000 without power as 11cm hail falls in Qld

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt standing next to decorative desserts.

props.synopsis: Skye Gyngell was born in Sydney into a prominent broadcast family but made her mark globally as a "culinary visionary who influenced generations of chefs".

title.children: Tributes flow after Australian Michelin star chef Skye Gyngell dies

image.altText: Soldiers attend to an injured troop in a metro tunnel.

props.synopsis: As European security threats grow, German soldiers carry out drills in metro stations to prepare for urban warfare.

title.children: Berlin prepares for 'worst-case' scenario with late-night metro warfare drills

image.altText: David Pocock at a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Australians who share AI deepfakes of another person without consent could be sued or fined under a new bill.

title.children: 'You should own your own face': Pocock launches AI deepfake bill

image.altText: A young person holding trans pride flag.

props.synopsis: New Zealand has become the latest country to halt access to puberty blockers for young people with gender dysphoria but are they following best health practice or an outlier?

title.children: NZ is halting access to puberty blockers. What about the rest of the world?

image.altText: Digitally blurred people leaning over the side of a rubber dinghy collecting bags from the ocean.

props.synopsis: Police charge the chief officer of an international livestock carrier and three others, after half a tonne of cocaine was found floating off Western Australia's coast.

title.children: Half tonne of cocaine retrieved from WA waters, as livestock vessel chief charged

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: Perry Kouroumblis's lawyer has questioned former officers about their handling of evidence in the 1977 murder case that the prosecution said relied on DNA.

title.children: Lawyer questions handling of DNA evidence in Easey Street murder

image.altText: Jair Bolsonaro sitting in a maroon leather back seat of a car wearing a black jacket and jeans while photographers stand outside

props.synopsis: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro says medication he takes for hiccups made him so paranoid that he used a soldering iron to tamper with his court-mandated ankle monitor while under house arrest.

title.children: Bolsonaro says drug-induced paranoia made him tamper with ankle monitor

image.altText: Golfer smiling and holding a trophy after winning a a tournament

props.synopsis: Min Woo Lee learned valuable lessons from the way he handled the first US PGA Tour win of his career, which are set to put him in a strong position to fire at the Australian PGA Championship.

title.children: Lee hails 'career best' mindset ahead of Australian PGA

image.altText: GettyImages-2248026288

props.synopsis: McLaren apologises to Norris and Piastri as F1 officials explain why the drivers were disqualified in Las Vegas.

title.children: What did McLaren do wrong in shock disqualification at Las Vegas GP?

image.altText: A man types on a laptop computer which is resting on his lap. The background is lit with red light.

props.synopsis: Whether you're an employee counting down the days until your break, or an employer trying to keep a business open over Christmas — what are the rules about working these holidays?

title.children: Do I have to work over the holidays, or use up leave if my workplace shuts?

image.altText: close up image of donald glover wearing a green jacket in front of a red wall

props.synopsis: Despite a "really bad pain" in his head, Donald Glover performed a full show before heading to the hospital where he was diagnosed with a stroke.

title.children: Donald Glover says 'bad pain' in his head was a stroke. What are the signs?

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: SA Police says it will restart its search for four-year-old Gus, who went missing in the state's Mid North almost two months ago.

title.children: SA Police to restart search for 4yo Gus, six mine shafts to be searched

image.altText: The front of Victoria's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: A report found Victoria recorded an operating loss of $2.6 billion in 2024-25, adding to accumulated losses of $50.6 billion over the last 6 years.

title.children: Victoria's auditor-general reports $400 million government budget blowout

image.altText: A profile image of Md Isfaqur Rahman wearing a white shirt, tie and jacket.

props.synopsis: The week-long murder trial of Brendan Kantilla, charged over the death of Bangladeshi student Md Isfaqur Rahman in 2023, has begun in the Northern Territory Supreme Court in Darwin.

title.children: Trial of man accused of murdering 23yo international student begins in Darwin

image.altText: A man and a woman being led by police officers in a street.

props.synopsis: At the age of six, the complainant was allegedly told she had a "beautiful mission from God" to be the wife of William "Little Pebble" Kamm.

title.children: Alleged cult leader granted bail ahead of child grooming trial

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water.

props.synopsis: The auditor-general who said Tasmania's ferry operator was operating while insolvent, has been told his comments were "causing real harm to the company and its stakeholders".

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania chair says it would be 'perverse' to let company go under

image.altText: woman is escorted to a seat inside a courtroom by a police man

props.synopsis: in 2014, Morgan Geyser and an accomplice nearly stabbed a classmate to death and later told police they did so to earn the right to be Slender Man's servants.

title.children: Woman behind Slender Man stabbing in 2014 is now missing

image.altText: A graphic showing an orange ID card with a man's photo on it and other details blurred.

props.synopsis: Data obtained in an ABC investigation shows the bulk of fines for selling illicit tobacco — tens of millions of dollars — are not being paid.

title.children: Illegal tobacco sellers leave tens of millions of fines unpaid

image.altText: A man with a shaved head wearing a red hooded jumper.

props.synopsis: The death of a Perth man authorities initially linked to the Optus Triple Zero outage is likely not connected to the failure, according to WA Police.

title.children: Perth man's death unlikely to be connected to Optus Triple Zero outage

image.altText: A satellite view shows water in a dam surrounded by mountains

props.synopsis: As Iran suffers through a drought and the president warns the capital could be evacuated, millions are worried about what the future will hold.

title.children: Tehran close to running dry due to 'water bankruptcy'

image.altText: An Australian bowler holds the ball as he gestures to the captain on the ground during a Test.

props.synopsis: Australia coach Andrew McDonald provides an update on sidelined quicks Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood ahead of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba.

title.children: Australia gives latest on injured pace aces Hazlewood and Cummins

image.altText: A woman stands with arms crossed in front of a bus.

props.synopsis: A Rail, Tram and Bus Union (RTBU) survey finds 73 per cent of female transport workers have suffered health issues due to inadequate toilet facilities.

title.children: Female transport workers exposed to 'horrendous', unsafe toilets on shift

image.altText: A close-up of Fiona's shoulder as she sits in a chair in a room.

props.synopsis: Women are twice as likely to suffer domestic violence in Papua New Guinea compared with the rest of the world, a new report finds. Here's what the country is doing to fix it.

title.children: Entering a new relationship is fraught with risk for women in this country

image.altText: Close-up image of David Cameron. He has a smile on his face.

props.synopsis: A biopsy showed he had prostate cancer, to which the former British prime minister said, "You always dread hearing those words."

title.children: David Cameron reveals he has been treated for prostate cancer

image.altText: A woman in an orange shirt poses in front of an abc banner

props.synopsis: The presenter will move to the NSW Weekend Mornings on Sundays, while NewsRadio's Thomas Oriti will step into the Drive hosting chair.

title.children: Chris Bath to depart ABC Radio Sydney Drive in move to Sundays

image.altText: A robot with a human-like face with its arms held high. Behind it is a red backdrop with white writing.

props.synopsis: There is now a global race to build humanoids that can walk, talk, reason, lift, carry, fetch, stack and generally operate in a human environment.

title.children: Humanoid robots will change work forever
